choices.answer: Things you plan to acquire, do, or accomplish in the future
Things that are necessary or essential for life and survival
Things that reflect your fundamental beliefs; important
Things that are unnecessary but desired

questions.question: Which of the following would have the least influence on an a person's values?

choices.answer: Grade average
Friends
Movies
Religious affiliations

questions.question: Which of the following is not influenced by values?

choices.answer: What movies you watch
Where you go to eat
Nothing is influenced by values
Everything is influenced by values

questions.question: Which is an example of a trade-off?

choices.answer: Choosing between two similar items when one costs less
Choosing between two similar items when you like one better
Choosing one thing and giving up another
Choosing to purchase something with cash instead of credit
The value of the next best option in a trade-off
The cost of the option chosen in a trade-off
The cost of the next best option in a trade-off
The value of the option chosen in a trade-off
Water
Computer
Cell Phone
Friendship

questions.question: Which of the following statements about our interactions with money is NOT true

choices.answer: You are responsible for your present and your future self
Your present self impacts your future self
You are better off in a community than by yourself
Investment increases risk and reduces your ability to cope

questions.question: Which kind of activity would contribute most to well-being?

choices.answer: Something your friends like
Something inexpensive
Something your parents suggest doing
Something that makes you forget about everything else

questions.question: When should you stop financial planning?

choices.answer: At retirement
Never
Once you have reached your financial goals
When you have money in the bank

questions.question: Your goals are most likely to be accomplished if:

choices.answer: You let someone else manage them
You write them down
You talk about them
You think about them
